overview.summary: AWS Feature X is a new service that allows customers to automatically process and analyze data using AI capabilities.
overview.primary_use_case: Processing large volumes of data efficiently without managing infrastructure.
overview.problem_solved: Eliminates the need for customers to build and maintain complex data processing pipelines.

personas.name: Developer
personas.description: Application developers who need to integrate data processing capabilities into their applications.
key_tasks: Integrate Feature X API into applications

personas.name: Data Scientist
personas.description: Data scientists who need to process and analyze large datasets.
benefits: Focus on insights rather than infrastructure
Integration with other AWS analytics services

personas.name: Solutions Architect
personas.description: Architects who design solutions using AWS services.
key_tasks: Evaluate Feature X for customer use cases

key_concepts.name: Processing Job
key_concepts.description: A unit of work that processes a dataset according to specified configuration.

key_concepts.name: Data Source
key_concepts.description: The location of the input data, typically an S3 bucket.

key_concepts.name: Processing Options
key_concepts.description: Configuration parameters that control how data is processed.

key_concepts.name: Output Location
key_concepts.description: The destination where processed results are stored.

key_concepts.name: Job Status
key_concepts.description: The current state of a processing job (e.g., PENDING, RUNNING, COMPLETED, FAILED).

content_structure.title: What is AWS Feature X?
content_structure.purpose: Introduce Feature X and its key capabilities.
key_points: How it works at a high level

content_structure.title: Getting Started with Feature X
content_structure.purpose: Help users quickly set up and run their first processing job.

examples.description: Creating a job through the AWS Management Console
Creating a job using the AWS CLI

visuals: Console screenshot of job creation form

subsections.title: Setting Up Permissions
subsections.purpose: Guide users through required IAM permissions.

subsections.title: Your First Processing Job
subsections.purpose: Step-by-step guide to create and monitor a job.

content_structure.title: Feature X API Reference
content_structure.purpose: Provide detailed API documentation for developers.

examples.description: Creating a job using the AWS SDK for Python
Creating a job using the AWS SDK for JavaScript

subsections.title: Error Handling
subsections.purpose: Guide developers on handling API errors.

content_structure.title: Security and Compliance
content_structure.purpose: Address security considerations and compliance information.

content_structure.title: Best Practices
content_structure.purpose: Provide guidance on optimal use of Feature X.

tutorials: Integrating Feature X with other AWS services
Building a serverless data processing pipeline

cross_references.description: Used for storing input data and processing results
Can be used to trigger processing jobs or handle job completion events
Can be used to automate workflows based on job status changes
Powers the AI capabilities of Feature X

security_considerations: Data is encrypted at rest using AWS KMS
Data is encrypted in transit using TLS
Access control is managed through IAM
VPC endpoints are supported for enhanced network security

resources.title: Feature X Workshop
resources.description: Hands-on workshop for learning Feature X

resources.title: Sample Applications
resources.description: GitHub repository with sample applications using Feature X

glossary.definition: A unit of work that processes a dataset according to specified configuration.
The location of the input data, typically an S3 bucket.
Configuration parameters that control how data is processed.
The current state of a processing job (e.g., PENDING, RUNNING, COMPLETED, FAILED).

improvement_suggestions.rationale: Users often need help diagnosing and resolving common issues.

improvement_suggestions.suggestion: Expand the API reference with more code examples
improvement_suggestions.rationale: Developers learn better with concrete examples in multiple programming languages.

improvement_suggestions.suggestion: Create a separate section for integration patterns
improvement_suggestions.rationale: Many users will want to integrate Feature X with other AWS services in common patterns.
